question.title: Best way to convert a Flink DataStream<POJOs> to a DataStream<RowData> for Apache Iceberg consumption
question.body:
I am new to Flink and trying to use Flink with Kafka as data input and iceberg for storing the data. Here are the steps I have done.

  1. Read A Datastream of java POJOs from kafkaSource (with a Avro schema).
  2. Convert the Datastream of POJOs to DataStream RowData by using MapFunction wrapper.
  3. Send the DataStream of RowData to Iceberg using FlinkSink.

Everything works but My concern is with the way I am converting the DataStream of POJOs to DataStream of RowData. I have a complex and pretty big POJO reference and to convert it to RowData, I had to use .setField() method for each and handle each dataType transformation like StringData,Map, List etc.

I wanted to check here, if there is a better way to do this.
